TopicPipeline#

Usage guide

class tweetopic.pipeline.TopicPipeline(vectorizer: Vectorizer, topic_model: TopicModel)#

Provides a full pipeline for topic modelling with useful utilities.

Parameters:

  • vectorizer (Vectorizer) – Transformer that extracts BOW embeddings from texts

  • topic_model (TopicModel) – Topic model to add to the pipeline.

fit(texts: Iterable[str]) → TopicPipeline#

Fits vectorizer and topic model with the given stream of texts.

Parameters:

texts (iterable of str) – Stream of texts to fit the pipeline with.

Returns:

Fitted pipeline.

Return type:

TopicPipeline

fit_transform(texts: Iterable[str]) → Union[ArrayLike, spmatrix]#

Fits vectorizer and topic model and transforms the given text.

Parameters:

texts (iterable of str) – Texts to transform.

Returns:

Document-topic matrix.

Return type:

array-like or sparse matrix of shape (n_documents, n_components)

transform(texts: Iterable[str]) → Union[ArrayLike, spmatrix]#

Transforms given texts with the fitted pipeline.

Parameters:

texts (iterable of str) – Texts to transform.

Returns:

Document-topic matrix.

Return type:

array-like or sparse matrix of shape (n_documents, n_components)

visualize(texts: Iterable[str])#

Visualizes the model with pyLDAvis for inspection of the different mixture components :)

Parameters:

texts (iterable of str) – Texts to visualize the model with.

Raises:

ModuleNotFoundError – If pyLDAvis is not installed an exception is thrown.

visualise(texts: Iterable[str])#

Alias of visualize() for those living on this side of the Atlantic.

top_words(top_n: int | None = 10) → list[dict[str, int]]#

Calculates the top words for each cluster.

Parameters:

top_n (int or None, default 10) – Top N words to return. If None, all words are returned.

Returns:

Dictionary for each cluster mapping the words to number of occurances.

Return type:

list of dict of str to int

Raises:

NotFittedException – If the model is not fitted, an exception will be raised.
